---
title: 'College Majors'
output: html_notebook
---

```{r, message = FALSE}
library(scales)
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r, message = FALSE}
data <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2018-10-16/recent-grads.csv')
```

```{r}
data <- data %>%
  mutate(Major = str_to_title(Major),
         Major = fct_reorder(Major, Median),
         Major_category = fct_reorder(Major_category, Median)) %>%
  arrange(desc(Median))
```

```{r}
data_by_major_category <- data %>%
  filter(!is.na(Total)) %>%
  group_by(Major_category) %>%
  summarize(Men = sum(Men),
            Women = sum(Women),
            Total = sum(Total),
            MedianSalary = sum(Median * Sample_size) / sum(Sample_size)) %>%
  mutate(ShareWomen = Women / Total) %>%
  arrange(desc(ShareWomen))
```

## What major categories make more money?

```{r, dev = 'svg'}
data %>%
  ggplot(aes(Major_category, Median, fill = Major_category)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  coord_flip() +
  expand_limits(y = 0) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = dollar_format()) +
  theme(axis.title.y = element_blank(),
        legend.position = 'none')
```
